description.narrative: Parents and communities have improved knowledge and commitment to contribute to enrolling children at the right age in quality learning in safe and protective school environments., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Skills Development, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 5: All children access and complete quality education, within a safe learning environment, with skills and knowledge for lifelong learning

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth
Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Early childhood education
Education Research
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education policy and administrative management
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Multi-hazard response preparedness
No Poverty
Primary education
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
Quality Education
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - gender equitable skills development (excluding SRGBV)
System strengthening - life skills (for personal empowerment, active citizenship, etc.)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Teacher Training
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
Technical assistance - Learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Parents and communities have improved knowledge and commitment to contribute to enrolling children at the right age in quality learning in safe and protective school environments.

description.narrative: 914,025 out of school children (OOSC) participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through enrolment drive activities commenced in the 36 states under the guidance and leadership of UBEC through six geopolitical zones. 13,797 children benefited from Cash Transfer Programme (CTP) in Zamfara and Kebbi states. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of new entrants in grade 1 who have attended early childhood education in UNICEF focus states
Service Delivery - Gender - Schools that have included life skills and citizenship education in their school plans with support from the UNICEF ECM programme
Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
Percentage of boys and girls enrolled in primary 1 at the right age
Number of States implementing Enrolment Drive framework to reduce OOSC

2.10 Cash transfers: Cash transfer system is being effectively IMPLEMENTED including the expanding coverage and improving inclususion of children (e.g. beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms).
